Alumni Spotlight: Caroline Pierce (2016) graduated in May 2020 from UNC-Charlotte with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Criminal Justice and a minor in Legal Studies. While she was a student at UNCC, she worked for Geospatial Analytics (GIS) in crime mapping.

Caroline completed an internship at the Union County District Attorney’s Office and is interested in future employment in a law office or with other government agencies that are related to legal practice or public safety. She also enjoys politics and is interested in working with local, state and federal campaigns. Currently she is working as a field director in Cabarrus County for campaign related business.

In the future, Caroline plans to pursue a graduate degree in Criminal Justice and possibly attend law school.

post_text: Siera Lunn (2015) graduated from Duke University in May 2019 with a B.S. in Biology and minors in psychology and chemistry and was named to the Dean’s List seven semesters. During her junior year, Siera participated in the Bass Connections Pocket Colposcope team. Her team’s goal was to introduce the pocket colposcope, a HPV and cervical cancer screening device, into Peru’s healthcare system to combat its high cervical cancer mortality rate. For her senior thesis, she investigated the effect of natural and synthetic hormones on the skin microbiome of two lemur species, and because of her outstanding thesis, she received the award of “Graduation with High Distinction in Biology.” While in college, Siera enjoyed tutoring students in the Durham community, guiding elementary and middle school students through engineering projects, and volunteering at a local hospital. She also loved getting to travel with her friends. Siera is now working as a college advisor, through Duke College Advising Corps at Hobbton High School and hopes to start medical school in the Fall of 2021.

post_text: Joe Malone (2013) graduated from Western Carolina University in May 2017 with a degree in Criminal Justice. He then successfully completed Basic Law Enforcement Training and upon graduation in December 2017 accepted a job as a police officer with the Monroe Police Department. In 2019, Joe changed roles within the department and is currently a criminal investigator. Joe married Alyssa Coan (2012) in 2018, and the couple purchased their first house where they live with their dogs.
